title: Census of Population and Housing 2024 report presented to President
byline: The report on the ’Census of Population and Housing 2024,’ conducted by the Census and Statistics Department was officially handed over to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake this morning (07) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Parliament informs Election Commission of vacant seat
byline: Parliament has officially informed the Election Commission that a Parliamentary seat has fallen vacant with the demise of NPP Kegalle District MP Kosala Nuwan Jayaweera who passed away yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes over 700,000 tourists in first quarter of 2025
byline: A total of 722,276 tourist arrivals were recorded during the first three months of 2025, according to the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA).

title: Chamara Sampath further remanded
byline: Badulla District MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake has been further remanded until April 21 by the Badulla Magistrate’s Court.

title: Man arrested with sea cow flesh in Mannar
byline: A man was arrested by wildlife officers from the Vavuniya Wildlife Zone and the Mannar site for possessing one kilogram of sea cow (Dugong dugon) flesh.

title: Anuradhapura airbase designated as Int’l airport for a day
byline: The Anuradhapura airbase was declared an international airport effective for one day to facilitate the departure of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a separate aircraft to Rameswaram in the southern part of India yesterday.

title: Economy shows steady progress: CBSL Governor informs President
byline: Presenting the Annual Economic Review for 2024 (AER 2024) to President and Minister of Finance, Anura Kumara Disanayake, Governor of the Central Bank Dr. P. Nandalal Weerasinghe highlighted the steady progress of Sri Lanka’s economic recovery following the country’s most severe downturn in recent history.

title: MDMK leader Vaiko condemns India-Sri Lanka defence MoU
byline: Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (MDMK) General Secretary Vaiko condemned the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between India and Sri Lanka for defence cooperation during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to the neighbouring island nation.

title: Namal leaves CID
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa who arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), left the premises a short while ago after recording a statement .

title: Sri Lanka braces for intense heat, heavy rains
byline: While several parts of the island are expected to experience heavy rainfall above100 mm, the sun is also currently passing directly overhead in several areas.

title: Customs thwart multiple smuggling attempts of illegal cigarettes worth over Rs. 24 Mn
byline: Sri Lanka Customs in a major enforcement operation has seized a large quantity of foreign cigarettes smuggled into the country by several local passengers.

title: Saudi Arabia imposes temporary visa ban for 14 countries
byline: Saudi authorities have announced a temporary visa ban affecting 14 countries ahead of the Hajj season. The suspension applies to Umrah, business, and family visas, with restrictions expected to end by mid-June, according to diplomatic sources.

title: Namal Rajapaksa arrives at CID
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning.

title: Man allegedly attempted to open plane door on flight to Sydney
byline: A Jordanian national allegedly attempted to open the doors of a Sydney-bound plane on Saturday evening and had to be restrained by crew and other passengers, forcing the airline to request police assistance on arrival.

title: Leading liquor store owner booked for promoting booze sales through Facebook
byline: A leading liquor store chain owner cum hotelier had been booked by the Department of Excise yesterday for promoting booze sales through Facebook by using attractive discounts, thus violating the NATA Act. The Excise also took a large stock of foreign liquor kept in possession sans paying duty, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Sri Lanka turns to India to stem fallout of U.S. tariffs
byline: In the wake of U.S. President Donald Trump slapping increased tariffs on imports, Sri Lanka sought to strengthen economic cooperation with India during the visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: NPP MP Kosala Nuwan passes away
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament (MP) Kosala Nuwan has passed away at the age of 38 after suffering a heart attack, hospital sources said.

title: Asian stocks see their worst drop in decades after Trump tariffs
byline: Asian stocks from Shanghai to Tokyo and Sydney to Hong Kong plunged on Monday to levels not seen in decades, as global markets continue to reel from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: SpaceX capsule splashes down after first crewed polar orbit flight
byline: A SpaceX Dragon capsule carrying four space tourists splashed down off the coast of California on Friday. This was the first crewed mission to fly a polar orbit around the Earth, passing by both the North and South poles.

title: Jaffna family starts walking as protest demanding permanent residence from President
byline: A young family from Jaffna begun a protest walk, requesting permanent arrangements for their residence. The family of a 7-year-old boy, a 6-year-old girl, the husband and the wife, began their walk from Achuveli in Jaffna last evening (06 April).

title: Are Kandy destined to dominate another decade?
byline: Kandy Sports Club completed another domestic double on Sunday when they defeated CR and FC to clinch the Clifford Cup following up their league victory a couple of weeks ago.

title: Special transport arrangements for New Year season
byline: Special transport arrangements have been made for the New Year season by the Transport Ministry, the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB), the National Transport Commission (NTC), and the Railway Department to facilitate travel from Colombo and its suburbs to other provinces.

title: Sri Lanka-India yacht clubs expand reciprocal access to boost marine tourism
byline: The Chamber of Marine Industry in Sri Lanka (CMISL) and India’s Royal Madras Yacht Club (RMYC) network, comprising four centers across Chennai, Ennore, Mysuru, and Puducherry, have inked a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) to extend reciprocal privileges to their members, effective April 3, 2025.

title: ASPI plunges over 700 Points below 15,000 as global trade fears grip market
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) tumbled over  700 points today, crashing below the 15,000 mark as global economic tensions spilled over into the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE).

title: CSE Expands Reach with New Bandarawela Branch
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) has further extended its footprint with the official opening of its newest branch in Bandarawela, reinforcing its commitment to enhancing accessibility for investors across Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. and IMF discuss preliminary review of IMF fourth tranche
byline: Sri Lanka and the International Monetary Fund (IMF)held discussions on Sri Lanka’s progress thus far under the IMF-supported programme and the next steps required to achieve the country’s future economic targets.

title: CA suspends holding election for CMC and several other LG institutions
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim injunction preventing any further steps from being taken in relation to the local government elections in several local government institutions, including the Colombo Municipal Council.

title: Batter Brook named England white-ball captain
byline: The 26-year-old replaces Jos Buttler, who stepped down after England were knocked out of the Champions Trophy in February.

title: SJB challenges EC over alleged inaction on NPP Kesbewa nomination list
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) filed a writ and a fundamental rights applications challenging the Election Commission’s alleged failure and inaction in respect of proceeding with the nomination list submitted by the National People’s Power (NPP) for the 2025 Local Authorities Election for the Kesbewa Urban Council.

title: Yevan joins Motopark for Euroformula Open Campaign
byline: The motorsport world is buzzing with excitement as one of the brightest talents in racing, Yevan David, has officially signed with Motopark for the highly anticipated 2025 Euroformula Open Championship.

title: Tamil parties sought India’s assistance for socio-economic development of estate community: Mano
byline: Several Opposition political parties which met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit to Sri Lanka called for Indian assistance for socio-economic development of the plantation community, Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) leader MP Mano Ganesan said today.

title: Foreign Minister meets Julie Chung over US tariffs
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath met with US Ambassador Julie Chung to discuss matters related to the reciprocal tariffs imposed on Sri Lanka by the US recently.

title: In-depth understanding of world politics needed to deal with fallout of U.S. tariffs: Wajira
byline: An in-depth understanding of world politics is needed to deal with the fallout of the U.S. tariffs on Sri Lanka, UNP Chairman Wajira Abeywardena said.

title: Defence agreement not detrimental to Sri Lanka: President
byline: While claiming that the defence agreement with India is not detrimental to the country, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today that agreements were only reached to regulate existing joint operations, training programmes and research activities between India and Sri Lanka.

title: Maithripala arrives at CID
byline: Former President Maithripala Sirisena arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago to provide a statement regarding the disbursement of funds from the Presidential Fund to several individuals, including politicians, police said.
